intro: Selliguea kamborangana, commonly known as the Kambora rock fern, is a species of liverwort found in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure. The plant typically grows on moist, shaded rocks or soil, thriving in humid environments. Its small, intricate leaves are arranged in a compact, cushion-like form. Selliguea kamborangana plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
